etymology.description: Phonetic: 甫(甫) (fǔ, "garden") + Semantic: 寸(寸) (cùn, "hand") -> original reference to sprout in field -> meaning "to distribute crops"
etymology.interpretation: The character 尃(fū, "disperse") combines the idea of a hand 寸(寸) (cùn, "hand") involved in the act of distributing or spreading, alongside the notion of a sprout 甫(甫) (fǔ, "garden") growing in a field. This suggests an agricultural application of spreading or dispersing seeds or crops.

examples.chinese: 暴风过后(暴風過後)，乌云尃散(烏雲尃散)。
examples.pinyin: Bào fēng guò hòu, wū yún fū sàn.
examples.english: After the storm, the dark clouds dispersed.

examples.chinese: 敌兵见到我军时(敵兵見到我軍時)，纷纷尃散(紛紛尃散)。
examples.pinyin: Dí bīng jiàn dào wǒ jūn shí, fēn fēn fū sàn.
examples.english: When the enemy soldiers saw our troops, they dispersed one after another.

examples.chinese: 警报响起时(警報響起時)，人群尃散(人群尃散)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐng bào xiǎng qǐ shí, rén qún fū sàn.
examples.english: When the alarm sounded, the crowd dispersed.
